LocationNotes: Exposure at the village of Zeleny Mys
VegDescription: Drained lake bottom overgrown with fireweed. Chamaenerion angustifolium (L.) Scop., Tanacetum vulgare L., Erigeron acris L., Poa pratensis L., Hordeum jubatum. (L.) Nevski, Salix glauca L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

VegDescription: Fescue–petrophyte–forb steppe (projective cover 60%; on bare spots, up to 80–90% siltstone fragments). Festuca lenensis Drobow, Poa attenuata Trin., Carex pediformis C.A. Mey, Dracocephalum palmatum Stephan., Thymus diversifolius Klokov, Veron ica incana L., Eremogone tschuktschorum (Regel) Ikonn., Dianthus versicolor Fisch. ex Link., Galium verum L., Pulsatilla multifida (Pritz.) Juz., Potentilla nivea L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River right bedrock bank (southern slope, up to 45°), opposite the Ambolikha River inflow
VegDescription: Grass–petrophyte–forb steppe (projective cover 50%) on a mobile sediment. Plants form pillows or small tussocks retaining the sediment. Dracocephalum palmatum Stephan., Thymus diversifolius Klokov, Eremogone tschuktschorum (Regel) Ikonn., Dianthus versicolor Fisch. ex Link., Festuca lenensis Drobow, Calamagrostis purpurascens R. Br., Pulsatilla multifida (Pritz.) Juz., Potentilla nivea L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River right bedrock bank (southern slope, up to 60°), opposite the Ambolikha River inflow
VegDescription: Grass–petrophyte–forb steppe (projective cover up to 60–70%), with bare sediment spots. Plants form tussocks retaining the sediment. Veronica incana L., Dracocephalum palmatum Stephan, Thymus diversifolius Klokov, Festuca lenensis Drobow, Calamagrostis purpurascens R. Br., Artemisia dracunculus L., Potentilla nivea L., Silene stenophylla Ledeb., Allium strictum Schrad., Chamaenerion angustifolium (L.) Scop. The outlier is edged by a larch forest composed of Larix cajanderi Mayr., with undergrowth of Betula divaricata Ledeb., Salix glauca L., Vaccinium vitisidaea L., V. uliginosum L., Rosa acicularis Lindl., and Ledum palustre L.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211

VegDescription: Dwarf birch–larch forest. Larix cajanderi Mayr., Betula divaricata Ledeb., Salix glauca L., S. pulchra Cham., Ledum decumbens (Ait.) Lodd. ex Steud., Vaccinium uliginosum L., V. vitisidaea L., Arctous alpina (L.) Spreng., Empetrum nigrum L., E. androgynum V.N. Vassil., Rosa acicularis Lindl., Arctagrostis latifolia R. LocationNotes: Lower Kolyma River course, right bedrock bank at the settlement of Kur ishka.
VegDescription: Nanopolygonal tundra, 20% of polygons are occupied by overgrowth spots of different age, prominent sedge and grass tus socks with size of 40–60 cm. Betula exilis Sukacz., B. nana L., Vaccinium vitisidaea L., V. uliginosum L., Empetrum nigrum L., E. androgynum V.N. Vassil., Alopecurus alpinus Smith, Carex concolor R. VegDescription: Sphagnum bog. On bog hummocks, Betula exilis Sukacz., Salix myrtilloides (L.), Oxycoccus microcarpus Turcz. ex Rupr., Ledum decumbens (Ait.) Lodd. ex Steud., Vaccinium uliginosum L., Chamaedaphne calyculata (L.) Moench., Rubus chamaemorus L., Carex gynocrates Wormsk, Eriophorum polystachion L. Around the bog, rare dead Larix cajanderi Mayr. with lichen Alectoria jubata (L.) Mot. on the branches

LocationNotes: Panteleikha River valley at the Komarok River inflow
VegDescription: Cottongrass–sedge bog with dwarf birch and willow. Sedge tussocks, 20–25 cm high, in stagnant water. Eriophorum vagi natum L., Carex juncella (Fries) Th. Fries, Betula exilis Sukacz., Salix pulchra Cham., Veratrum lobelianum Bernh.
Publication1: Lopatina & Zanina 2016 Subrecent Spore–Pollen Spectra from the Lower Kolyma River Basin and Their Importance for the Reconstruction of the Quaternary Paleogeography of the Region. Stratigraphy and Geological Correlation, 2016, Vol. 24, No. 2, pp. 203–211
